fields.headline: Snippets
fields.bodyText: Marc Jacobs' first UK boutique It's a testament to the power of Marc Jacobs that his is one of the most-worn designer labels in this country, even though the New Yorker has never had his own shop in the UK. This will all change in a few weeks' time when Harvey Nichols opens a Marc Jacobs in-store boutique at its London flagship, effectively making it the first Jacobs store in Europe. The boutique will offer a more comprehensive selection of the Jacobs collection than previously available. Next season, it focuses on a punkish take on 50s high-waisted skirts, sweaters and cardigan jackets. His main range is notoriously expensive, but on a different floor, Harvey Nichols is also expanding its offering of the cheaper and wildly popular Marc by Marc Jacobs line into what is unofficially being dubbed "A World of Marc". It's all part of Harvey Nichols' still-secret plans to counteract the Selfridges tidal wave of the past few months, hinting that the department store wars will rage on throughout 2003.
